title: R & Python for Business and Management
text:
Course held for at CUNEF Univesidad Bachelor in Business Management second year as part of the Minor in Data Science elective path. The aim of the course is to provide student with the basic concepts of R and Python programming languages focusing on data analytics so they can have the essential skills needed for future subjects related with the field.



Programming in R: R and RStudio basics, data types, programming structures, data importing, tidyverse, visualization with ggplot2 and advance programming (functions and purrr library)
Programming in Python: Python (Anaconda and Jupyter) basics, data types, programming structures, pandas for data analytics, visualization with mathplotlib, advance topics (function, numpy and scipy)

title: Digitalization of Financial Entities and Payment Systems
text: Final thesis developed as part of the Bachelor in Business Management at Universitat Politécnica de Valéncia.

title: Digitalization of Financial Entities and Payment Systems
text:
Summary
Technological evolution has changed in many ways our society. Among the different areas where technological advancements have given us improvements and change how we operate, we can highlight the financial sector, where innovation has changed substantially the different processes involved in their services and financial structures. We can focus on the improvements obtained in the payment systems due to the necessity of reliability, security, and immediacy in the process of transfer money between the different agents in the economy.
These advancements in the payment systems are the result of different causes, especially the development of new business models based on technology and the intrusion of bigtech companies, increasing their presence in the payment industry. The development of new technologies and their applications in this area are also one of the main reasons behind this revolution. This has forced banks and other financial institutions to accelerate their innovation process to reach new customers and cope with these new companies.
In this paper, we will focus our study on the payment systems, how they operate, and the different payment services related. We will identify the main threats and opportunities is facing the payment industry and how financial entities and banks are managing their strategies to deal with these situations

title: Digitalization of Financial Entities and Payment Systems
text:
Thesis Structure
The thesis is divided in two parts. First, we look for summarize the different concepts regarding financial entities, banking system and payments in Spain and European Union. Second, we focus on changes occurring at the payment sector, new competitors as bigtech companies, new payment systems as cripto-currencies or digital money. In addition, we make an analysis of the different strategies being followed by the different banks inside the Spanish financial system, making a comparison between their strengths and opportunities to compete and develop at the sector.
Between the conclusions, we understand the importance of the payment system for the banking institutions, being cooperation and investment in start-ups the main strategies for compete and develop new business cases. And we emphasize the importance of the technological evolution for this sector, being the new payment systems related with cripto-currencies and digital money key aspects.



Viñals Guitart, C. (2021). La digitalización de las entidades financieras y los sistemas de pago. Universitat Politècnica de València.

Following the thesis, we do an article related with the research done for the digital magazine Finance, Markets and Valuation. You can find it here.






About Finance, Markets and Valuation



Finance, Markets and Valuation is a scientific online magazine that publishes each semester different editions that collect articles related with research and analysis about economy, finance, marketing among other fields. It is edited by Asociación para la Investigación para la Formación y la Investigación en Ciencias Económicas y Sociales.


The article focuses on the analysis about payments sector. Making a summary of the content seen about challenges and opportunities found on the sector, while update some of the content of the thesis.

title: Design and Implementation of a Ranking System for ASys
text: Final thesis developed as part of the Bachelor in Computer Science at Universitat Politécnica de Valéncia.

title: Design and Implementation of a Ranking System for ASys
text:
Summary
The aim of the project was developing a ranking system for ASys. A platform developed for providing student different auto-correctable exercises to help them improving their learning process.
We have develop a ranking and statistical dashboard for providing students with information regarding their progress and compete, motivating and encouraging to do more exercises.

title: Design and Implementation of a Ranking System for ASys
text:
Technology
The project was developed using Java programming language with the use of Spring framework. The platform client was developed using Vue JS, HTML and CSS.
In addition other techonolgies such as MySQL and MinIO for storing data and resources has been used.



Viñals Guitart, C. (2021). Diseño y Desarrollo de un Sistema de Ranking para ASys. Universitat Politècnica de València.

title: Predicting Car Accidents Severity
text: Project developed as part of the Master in Data Science at CUNEF Universidad. Together with my colleague Álvaro Serrano we develop a model for predicting car accident severity with the help of Kaggle’s Canadian Car Accidents Dataset

title: Predicting Car Accidents Severity
text:
The model
The first part of the work was understanding the data, cleaning and view how we can build a model with it. With an Exploratory Data Analysis we decide the most suitable variables and detect anomalies like duplicate registers, outliers, etc.
Once deeply studied the data, we try to choose different models. Among the used ones, we can remark decision trees, random forest, support vector machine, XGBoost and lightGBM. With the use of key metrics such as precision, recall and visual analysis with confusion matrix we compare the different models.The decision behind this metrics resides in the highly unbalanced sample of data making not reliable the use of metrics such as accuracy. Finally, XGBoost was our best model for predict car accident severity.
Finally, we optimize the model improving hiperparameters and with the help of Sapley Values method we try to explain the inner working of the model to understand the reasons behind its predictions and avoid the “black box” of a machine learning model.
You can see our full work with plenty of detail and detailed explanations in different notebooks in our repository (Spanish).

title: Predicting Car Accidents Severity
text:
API
For second part, we decide to create an API with our model so it can be used for making predictions and being called. For doing this we use flask framework, the API was implemented with a full logging system for record errors, calls and have full historic of tasks done. All was built inside a docker container to facilitate deployment.
You can find the API code and all work done in the repository (Spanish)
